value: Frontispiece for Book 4, in Eight books of Ornament

label: Description
value: First book (dedicated to Lord Middlesex): title page and six plates, dated 1741, of rocaille cartouches; second book (dedicated to the Earl of Holderness): title page and five rocaille motifs, dated 1742; third book (dedicated to the Duke of Rutland): title page and six plates of cartouches, dated 1743; fifth book; title page and fourteen plates (one bound upside down) of furniture, dated 1743; sixth and seventh books: title pages (half-size) and fourteen plates of cartouches, undated; eighth book: title page and six plates of jewelery, dated 1747.

label: Physical description
value: Engravings on white laid paper, bound in half-calf and marbled boards

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Printing block with copper insets. Design shows warrior with pulled arrow, tree and mountains in the background. Used as a bale block for marking sacks and ends of bolts of cotton fabric.

label: Description
value: Printing block with copper insets. Design shows Don Quixote on a prancing horse. Used as a bale block for marking sacks and ends of bolts of cotton fabric.

label: Description
value: View looking across a Paris boulevard, with a priest and numerous other figures in the scene.  Bare trees in the center strip dividing the street.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on paper, laid down on cardboard

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Griffith Baily Coale
Port Side of S.S. Nansemonde, Showing Camouflage

label: Description
value: The ship faces left. Stripe camouflage. Specifications given in box, upper right. Approved, lower right.

label: Physical description
value: Color lithograph on paper, laid down on cardboard

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Griffith Baily Coale
Port Side of 5075 Tanker, Showing Camouflage

label: Description
value: The ship faces left. Arc camouflage. Specifications given in box, upper right. Approved, lower right.

label: Physical description
value: Color lithograph on paper, laid down on cardboard

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Griffith Baily Coale
Starboard Side and Details of 5075 Tanker, Showing Camouflage

label: Description
value: Ship seen facing right. Design of camouflage in large arcs. Above, six details of patterning. Specifications given in box, upepr right. Approved, lower right.

label: Physical description
value: Color lithograph on paper, laid down on cardboard

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Griffith Baily Coale
Funeral of James Cardinal Gibbons at Roman Catholic Cathedral, Baltimore, MD

label: Description
value: Sketch of the interior of the Roman Cahtolic Cathedral in Baltimore, MD, showing a funeral. The crossing with the cataflaque is surrounded by mourners and burning candles.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Griffith Baily Coale
Funerary Portrait of James Cardinal Gibbons

label: Description
value: The Cardinal is seen from the left, below, with only head and shoulders shown. A candle and candle-holder are seen in the immediate foreground. Color notations.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Griffith Baily Coale

label: Description
value: Sketch looking through an upper window. The Washington Monument is in the left foreground, with the Walters Art Gallery (at the corner of Center and Charles Streets) at left and the Peabody School of Music, lower right center. Tall buildings in the distance. Color notes throughout.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Griffith Baily Coale

label: Description
value: A figure stands in a four-wheeled cart drawn by a horse and shovels dirt from it. Buildings outlined behind.
Mexican Children near a Well, New Mexico

label: Description
value: Two children are seen seated at the base of a well.

label: Description
value: View looking across the rim on the canyon, semi-abstractly rendered.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Description
value: Figure with a headress turned towards the right, bending forward, with right leg and right arm raised in a dance.
Koshari–or Indian Fun-maker, Santa Domingo, New Mexico

label: Description
value: Figure with a headress turned towards the left, bending forward, with left leg and arms raised in a dance.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in black ink on paper

label: Description
value: Wallpaper commemorating the Paris Exposition of 1855. Two repeats of main building and a smaller building, alternating. Flanking them, the Marly Horse sculptures at the entrance to the Champs Elyseés, and two city statues on pedestals on the Place de la Concorde. Printed in beige and brown on drab ground.

label: Provenance
value: From the house of Miss Sophia Credle, Washington, DC.

label: Physical description
value: Lithograph Support: smooth white wove paper
Fashion Plate from "Le Moniteur de la Mode"

label: Description
value: Four young women, one with a jump rope, right; a young man, left, on a bicycle, and a small child in white. Trees and a building beyond. Description on verso. Artists' and publisher's names, title and date, below.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Provenance
value: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1962: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Coach stuck fording a stream. It is tipping and the men are working to right it; the women are muddy. Title and artists' names below.

label: Physical description
value: Lithograph, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Provenance
value: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1962: acquired by Museum
Allons! Allons! Il faur partir, Plate 9 from "Inconvénient"

label: Description
value: Woman waking a couple in nightshirts, in an inn. Dog on a pillow, over two chairs, right center. Title and artists' names below.

label: Physical description
value: Lithograph, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Provenance
value: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1962: acquired by Museum
Livre Curieux et Utile pour Les Sçavans, et Artists. Composé de trois Alphabets de Chiffres, Simples, doubles et triples.

label: Description
value: Book of 153 pages of ornamental monogrames and some medallions. In addition, 16 plates of "Supports and Chimiera" for ornaments on armor: the 17th plate is bound in as a frontispiece. The "table" follows with the Forward placed last.

label: Physical description
value: Engravings on cream laid paper, bound in boards with leather spine
